messages.title: Moderate Conservatives Speak Out
messages.content:
"I'm impressed by Jo Swinson. I think if I was living in a lot of constituencies I would lend my vote to the Liberal Democrats" - Former Conservative justice secretary David Gauke 13/11/19
"Say no to Johnson and Corbyn and all of their candidates. Start the process of building something new" - Former Conservative Minister, Nick Boles
"I'm not sure yet, but I might protest and vote Lib Dem" - Ken Clarke - Conservative MP for 50 years
"Millions of Tories will now vote Lib Dem because of Brexit" - Former Conservative Deputy PM, Michael Heseltine
Can you trust Boris Johnson's Con-Brexit Party?

messages.title: Alex Hegenbarth: A strong voice for Tewkesbury
messages.content: Alex is a well-respected local councillor who is already working hard for residents in the Tewkesbury constituency. Born in Worcestershire, Alex has settled with his young family in Bishop’s Cleeve. Alex has been working with local residents across the Tewkesbury constituency on the issues that matter to them. Alex is also currently leading the drive for neighboring Cheltenham to become carbon-neutral by 2030. Alex will continue to campaign and fight for the funding our public services deserve.

messages.title: My top 3 priorities for Tewkesbury
messages.content:
1. Be a voice for local communities: We must support local businesses, workers and their families and make sure our community has the representation it deserves.
2. Fund public services: Stop the under-funding and cuts to our local schools, NHS, police force and other vital public services.
3. Protect our environment: Invest in green technology to create new jobs and help tackle the climate emergency.

messages.title: Election Choice
messages.content: Jeremy Corbyn will lose the election. Boris Johnson can't be trusted. Lib Dems CAN WIN for YOU. With your vote Alex Hegenbarth can win!

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Be a voice for local communities
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support local businesses, workers, and their families, and ensure the community has the representation it deserves.
Stop the under-funding and cuts to local schools, NHS, police force, and other vital public services.
Invest in green technology to create new jobs and tackle the climate emergency.
